channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Unveiling the Generalization Power of Fine-Tuned Large Language Models
item.description: While Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated exceptional multitasking abilities, fine-tuning these models on downstream, domain-specific datasets is often necessary to yield superior performance on test sets compared to their counterparts without fine-tuning.

item.title: LocalMamba: Visual State Space Model with Windowed Selective Scan
item.description: This paper posits that the key to enhancing Vision Mamba (ViM) lies in optimizing scan directions for sequence modeling.

item.title: Reawakening knowledge: Anticipatory recovery from catastrophic interference via structured training
item.description: We explore the training dynamics of neural networks in a structured non-IID setting where documents are presented cyclically in a fixed, repeated sequence.

item.title: Uncertainty Quantification for cross-subject Motor Imagery classification
item.description: We applied a variety of Uncertainty Quantification methods to predict misclassifications for a Motor Imagery Brain Computer Interface.

item.title: BurstAttention: An Efficient Distributed Attention Framework for Extremely Long Sequences
item.description: Effective attention modules have played a crucial role in the success of Transformer-based large language models (LLMs), but the quadratic time and memory complexities of these attention modules also pose a challenge when processing long sequences.

item.title: CodeUltraFeedback: An LLM-as-a-Judge Dataset for Aligning Large Language Models to Coding Preferences
item.description: We generate responses to the instructions using a pool of 14 diverse LLMs, which we then annotate according to their alignment with five coding preferences using the LLM-as-a-Judge approach with GPT-3. 5, producing both numerical and textual feedback.

item.title: Griffon v2: Advancing Multimodal Perception with High-Resolution Scaling and Visual-Language Co-Referring
item.description: Large Vision Language Models have achieved fine-grained object perception, but the limitation of image resolution remains a significant obstacle to surpass the performance of task-specific experts in complex and dense scenarios.

item.title: Single Domain Generalization for Crowd Counting
item.description: We propose MPCount, a novel SDG approach effective even for narrow source distribution.

item.title: D3T: Distinctive Dual-Domain Teacher Zigzagging Across RGB-Thermal Gap for Domain-Adaptive Object Detection
item.description: However, there are limited studies on adapting from the visible to the thermal domain, because the domain gap between the visible and thermal domains is much larger than expected, and traditional domain adaptation can not successfully facilitate learning in this situation.

item.title: Video Mamba Suite: State Space Model as a Versatile Alternative for Video Understanding
item.description: We categorize Mamba into four roles for modeling videos, deriving a Video Mamba Suite composed of 14 models/modules, and evaluating them on 12 video understanding tasks.

item.title: Knowledge Distillation in YOLOX-ViT for Side-Scan Sonar Object Detection
item.description: In this paper we present YOLOX-ViT, a novel object detection model, and investigate the efficacy of knowledge distillation for model size reduction without sacrificing performance.

item.title: Score-Guided Diffusion for 3D Human Recovery
item.description: We present Score-Guided Human Mesh Recovery (ScoreHMR), an approach for solving inverse problems for 3D human pose and shape reconstruction.

item.title: VM-UNET-V2 Rethinking Vision Mamba UNet for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: In the field of medical image segmentation, models based on both CNN and Transformer have been thoroughly investigated.

item.title: TaxoLLaMA: WordNet-based Model for Solving Multiple Lexical Sematic Tasks
item.description: It achieves 11 SotA results, 4 top-2 results out of 16 tasks for the Taxonomy Enrichment, Hypernym Discovery, Taxonomy Construction, and Lexical Entailment tasks.

item.title: Towards a theory of model distillation
item.description: Distillation is the task of replacing a complicated machine learning model with a simpler model that approximates the original [BCNM06, HVD15].

item.title: Pantypes: Diverse Representatives for Self-Explainable Models
item.description: Prototypical self-explainable classifiers have emerged to meet the growing demand for interpretable AI systems.

item.title: StreamMultiDiffusion: Real-Time Interactive Generation with Region-Based Semantic Control
item.description: The enormous success of diffusion models in text-to-image synthesis has made them promising candidates for the next generation of end-user applications for image generation and editing.

item.title: OpenGraph: Open-Vocabulary Hierarchical 3D Graph Representation in Large-Scale Outdoor Environments
item.description: Environment maps endowed with sophisticated semantics are pivotal for facilitating seamless interaction between robots and humans, enabling them to effectively carry out various tasks.

item.title: Counterfactual contrastive learning: robust representations via causal image synthesis
item.description: Contrastive pretraining is well-known to improve downstream task performance and model generalisation, especially in limited label settings.

item.title: uaMix-MAE: Efficient Tuning of Pretrained Audio Transformers with Unsupervised Audio Mixtures
item.description: Masked Autoencoders (MAEs) learn rich low-level representations from unlabeled data but require substantial labeled data to effectively adapt to downstream tasks.

item.title: Eta Inversion: Designing an Optimal Eta Function for Diffusion-based Real Image Editing
item.description: A commonly adopted strategy for editing real images involves inverting the diffusion process to obtain a noisy representation of the original image, which is then denoised to achieve the desired edits.

item.title: Easy-to-Hard Generalization: Scalable Alignment Beyond Human Supervision
item.description: This paper answers this question in the context of tackling hard reasoning tasks (e. g., level 4-5 MATH problems) via learning from human annotations on easier tasks (e. g., level 1-3 MATH problems), which we term as \textit{easy-to-hard generalization}.

item.title: DiTMoS: Delving into Diverse Tiny-Model Selection on Microcontrollers
item.description: Enabling efficient and accurate deep neural network (DNN) inference on microcontrollers is non-trivial due to the constrained on-chip resources.

item.title: Transformers Get Stable: An End-to-End Signal Propagation Theory for Language Models
item.description: In spite of their huge success, transformer models remain difficult to scale in depth.

item.title: S^2MVTC: a Simple yet Efficient Scalable Multi-View Tensor Clustering
item.description: Specifically, we first construct the embedding feature tensor by stacking the embedding features of different views into a tensor and rotating it.

item.title: Gradient-Aware Logit Adjustment Loss for Long-tailed Classifier
item.description: Additionally, We find that most of the solutions to long-tailed problems are still biased towards head classes in the end, and we propose a simple and post hoc prediction re-balancing strategy to further mitigate the basis toward head class.

item.title: When Semantic Segmentation Meets Frequency Aliasing
item.description: While positively correlated with the proposed aliasing score, three types of hard pixels exhibit different patterns.

item.title: SpikeReveal: Unlocking Temporal Sequences from Real Blurry Inputs with Spike Streams
item.description: Our approach begins with the formulation of a spike-guided deblurring model that explores the theoretical relationships among spike streams, blurry images, and their corresponding sharp sequences.

item.title: Explorations in Texture Learning
item.description: In this work, we investigate \textit{texture learning}: the identification of textures learned by object classification models, and the extent to which they rely on these textures.

item.title: GiT: Towards Generalist Vision Transformer through Universal Language Interface
item.description: Due to its simple design, this paradigm holds promise for narrowing the architectural gap between vision and language.

item.title: Don't Judge by the Look: A Motion Coherent Augmentation for Video Recognition
item.description: Current training pipelines in object recognition neglect Hue Jittering when doing data augmentation as it not only brings appearance changes that are detrimental to classification, but also the implementation is inefficient in practice.

item.title: Relaxing Accurate Initialization Constraint for 3D Gaussian Splatting
item.description: Through extensive analysis of SfM initialization in the frequency domain and analysis of a 1D regression task with multiple 1D Gaussians, we propose a novel optimization strategy dubbed RAIN-GS (Relaxing Accurate Initialization Constraint for 3D Gaussian Splatting), that successfully trains 3D Gaussians from random point clouds.

item.title: CardioCaps: Attention-based Capsule Network for Class-Imbalanced Echocardiogram Classification
item.description: In this paper, we explore the potential of DR-CapsNets and propose CardioCaps, a novel attention-based DR-CapsNet architecture for class-imbalanced echocardiogram classification.

item.title: Faceptor: A Generalist Model for Face Perception
item.description: This design enhances the unification of model structure while improving application efficiency in terms of storage overhead.

item.title: EventRPG: Event Data Augmentation with Relevance Propagation Guidance
item.description: Based on this, we propose EventRPG, which leverages relevance propagation on the spiking neural network for more efficient augmentation.

item.title: SD-Net: Symmetric-Aware Keypoint Prediction and Domain Adaptation for 6D Pose Estimation In Bin-picking Scenarios
item.description: Specifically, at the keypoint prediction stage, we designe a robust 3D keypoints selection strategy considering the symmetry class of objects and equivalent keypoints, which facilitate locating 3D keypoints even in highly occluded scenes.

item.title: Adversarial Fine-tuning of Compressed Neural Networks for Joint Improvement of Robustness and Efficiency
item.description: We present experiments on two benchmark datasets showing that adversarial fine-tuning of compressed models can achieve robustness performance comparable to adversarially trained models, while also improving computational efficiency.

item.title: Breast Cancer Classification Using Gradient Boosting Algorithms Focusing on Reducing the False Negative and SHAP for Explainability
item.description: The main objective of this study is to use state-of-the-art boosting algorithms such as AdaBoost, XGBoost, CatBoost and LightGBM to predict and diagnose breast cancer and to find the most effective metric regarding recall, ROC-AUC, and confusion matrix.

item.title: Recursive Causal Discovery
item.description: Presence and identification of removable variables allow recursive approaches for causal discovery, a promising solution that helps to address the aforementioned challenges by reducing the problem size successively.

item.title: SELECTOR: Heterogeneous graph network with convolutional masked autoencoder for multimodal robust prediction of cancer survival
item.description: To mitigate the impact of missing features within the modality on prediction accuracy, we devised a convolutional masked autoencoder (CMAE) to process the heterogeneous graph post-feature reconstruction.

item.title: AcademiaOS: Automating Grounded Theory Development in Qualitative Research with Large Language Models
item.description: AcademiaOS is a first attempt to automate grounded theory development in qualitative research with large language models.

item.title: PAPERCLIP: Associating Astronomical Observations and Natural Language with Multi-Modal Models
item.description: We present PAPERCLIP (Proposal Abstracts Provide an Effective Representation for Contrastive Language-Image Pre-training), a method which associates astronomical observations imaged by telescopes with natural language using a neural network model.

item.title: 7T MRI Synthesization from 3T Acquisitions
item.description: We demonstrate that the V-Net based model has superior performance in enhancing both single-site and multi-site MRI datasets compared to the existing benchmark model.

item.title: Multiscale Low-Frequency Memory Network for Improved Feature Extraction in Convolutional Neural Networks
item.description: Responding to these complexities, we introduce a novel framework, the Multiscale Low-Frequency Memory (MLFM) Network, with the goal to harness the full potential of CNNs while keeping their complexity unchanged.

item.title: Moments of Clarity: Streamlining Latent Spaces in Machine Learning using Moment Pooling
item.description: Moment Pooling generalizes the summation in Deep Sets to arbitrary multivariate moments, which enables the model to achieve a much higher effective latent dimensionality for a fixed latent dimension.

item.title: Learning to Describe for Predicting Zero-shot Drug-Drug Interactions
item.description: Adverse drug-drug interactions~(DDIs) can compromise the effectiveness of concurrent drug administration, posing a significant challenge in healthcare.

item.title: Mitigate Target-level Insensitivity of Infrared Small Target Detection via Posterior Distribution Modeling
item.description: Infrared Small Target Detection (IRSTD) aims to segment small targets from infrared clutter background.

item.title: SOTOPIA-$Ï€$: Interactive Learning of Socially Intelligent Language Agents
item.description: Motivated by this gap, we propose an interactive learning method, SOTOPIA-$\pi$, improving the social intelligence of language agents.

item.title: NTIRE 2023 Image Shadow Removal Challenge Technical Report: Team IIM_TTI
item.description: In this paper, we analyze and discuss ShadowFormer in preparation for the NTIRE2023 Shadow Removal Challenge [1], implementing five key improvements: image alignment, the introduction of a perceptual quality loss function, the semi-automatic annotation for shadow detection, joint learning of shadow detection and removal, and the introduction of new data augmentation techniques for shadow removal.

item.title: Language models scale reliably with over-training and on downstream tasks
item.description: We fit scaling laws that extrapolate in both the number of model parameters and the ratio of training tokens to parameters.
